org.hps.readout

Class TriggerDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.readout.ReadoutDriver
        • org.hps.readout.TriggerDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FEETrigger2019ReadoutDriver, HodoscopeStudiesTriggerReadoutDriver, PairsTrigger2019ReadoutDriver, PairTriggerReadoutDriver, PulserReadoutDriver, SinglesTrigger2019ReadoutDriver, SinglesTriggerReadoutDriver

    public abstract class TriggerDriver
extends ReadoutDriver
    Class TriggerDriver is a special subclass of ReadoutDriver that is responsible for simulating trigger behavior. It implements additional behavior for handling trigger dead times and issuing triggers to the ReadoutDataManager.

    Implementing drivers are responsible for checking if trigger conditions are met. In the event that they are, the method sendTrigger() should be used to issue the trigger to the data manager. This method will automatically check that the dead time condition is met, and will only issue the trigger command in the event that it is, so implementing drivers do not need to check this condition manually.

    For usage instructions, please see ReadoutDriver.
    See Also:
    ReadoutDriver

      • isInDeadTime

        protected boolean isInDeadTime()
        Checks whether the trigger is currently in dead time or not.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the trigger is currently in dead time, and false if it is not and a trigger may be issued.
